archeologyp1.mpt

Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • archeologyp1.mpt.UserInterface

  • public class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    USERINTERFACE FOR THE MAP POPULATION TOOL
    Author:
    Daniel, Celine This class handles most of the UI for the mpt, which includes adding a feature or a find, updating a coordinate, and changing a coordinate based on a single coordinate or an entire row.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeCoordinate()
      For the public void changeCoordinate method This method asks what type of change to the menu the user wants to make: a single coordinate, or an entire row on the map.

      For the public void pollFeatureorFind method This method asks whether the user wants to change a feature or add a find to the map.

    • Method Detail

      • pollFeatureorFind

        public void pollFeatureorFind()
        For the public void pollFeatureorFind method This method asks whether the user wants to change a feature or add a find to the map. If they want to change a feature, the menu will ask them for the option (among the unexcavated options available) they want to change it to, or whether they want to add a (collection of) find(s). If they want to add a find, the menu will then push them into a loop based on how many finds they want to add, and make them add the dates for each find.

      • updateCoordinate

        public void updateCoordinate()
        For the public void updateCoordinate method This method updates the coordinate in the map that's been changed.

      • changeCoordinate

        public void changeCoordinate()
        For the public void changeCoordinate method This method asks what type of change to the menu the user wants to make: a single coordinate, or an entire row on the map.
